results.title: Fighting Warrior for Commodore 64
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette, cover & manual insert in clear plastic cassette case
results.brief_description: Fighting Warrior [computer game] for Commodore 64. Fighting Warrior is a single player side scrolling fighting game. Players have a high, mid and low attack, jump, duck and step back and must fight oncoming enemies in one on one combat.
results.description: Fighting Warrior [computer game] for Commodore 64. Fighting Warrior is a single player side scrolling fighting game. Players have a high, mid and low attack, jump, duck and step back and must fight oncoming enemies in one on one combat.

results.title: Play It Again I: Games Collection
results.brief_description:
The Play It Again I project aimed to create a playable history of Australasian video games for industry, community and research purposes, by building on existing research into the history of Beam Software and their games from the 1980s.

This collection comprises physical games donated to ACMI for the project, audio captures and game emulation files - some created at ACMI as part of the project research and some harvested from external web repositories.

The multi-faceted project brought multidisciplinary expertise to bear on the areas of collections, preservation, accessibility, fan knowledge, and the telling of histories about Australia’s digital game history.

The project was undertaken by ACMI in partnership with Flinders University, University of Melbourne, The New Zealand Film Archive, Berlin Computerspiele Museum, and the Research Trust of Victoria University of Wellington. It was funded via the Australian Research Council (ARC) Linkage Projects scheme, which funds collaborative projects between University researchers and Partner Organisations.

The project was completed in 2015.

The multi-faceted project brought multidisciplinary expertise to bear on the areas of collections, preservation, accessibility, fan knowledge, and the telling of histories about Australia’s digital game history.

The project was undertaken by ACMI in partnership with Flinders University, University of Melbourne, The New Zealand Film Archive, Berlin Computerspiele Museum, and the Research Trust of Victoria University of Wellington. It was funded via the Australian Research Council (ARC) Linkage Projects scheme, which funds collaborative projects between University researchers and Partner Organisations.

results.title: The Tolkien Trilogy  for Commodore 64
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Two cassettes, paper manual, plastic cassette tray in a cardboard case
results.brief_description: Contains three games: ‘The Hobbit’, ‘Lord of the Rings’ and ‘Shadows of Mordor’. The games are loosely based on “The Hobbit” and “The Lord of the Rings” novels by J.R.R Tolkien
results.description: Contains three games: ‘The Hobbit’, ‘Lord of the Rings’ and ‘Shadows of Mordor’. The games are loosely based on “The Hobbit” and “The Lord of the Rings” novels by J.R.R Tolkien

results.title: You and I, Horizontal II
results.material_description: computer, computer script, projector and  haze machine
results.brief_description:
Step into a dark haze-filled room to interact with the power of projected light. Transforming a beam of light into a three-dimensional sculpture, Anthony McCall’s ‘You and I, Horizontal II’ (2006) is an Australian premiere.

The pioneering work of British-born artist Anthony McCall occupies a space between sculpture, cinema, performance and drawing. McCall was one of the first visual artists to experiment with spatial film and temporal sculpture, emerging in the mid 1970s with the ‘Solid Light’ film series - works that used a 16mm projector to project cones of light through smoke or haze filled rooms. His work attracted renewed attention in the 1990s, when spatial installations once again became a popular and critical tendency in contemporary art. He now uses digital projection and complex graphic software systems to capture the most basic sensory element of the moving image: the projection of light.

His work attracted renewed attention in the 1990s, when spatial installations once again became a popular and critical tendency in contemporary art. results.title: You and hydatids
results.creator_credit: Norman Laird and Tasmanian State Film Unit
results.brief_description: Warns against the danger of humans contracting hydatids through the careless handling of sheep and dog. Explains how, by eating offal from infected animals, the dog becomes the carrier of the disease between sheep and man. The disease my be prevented from spreading by boiling sheep offal prior to feeding to dogs, by carefully washing all vegetables to be eating raw by keeping the dog outside the home and car and by giving the dog regular medical examinations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Norman Laird and Tasmanian State Film Unit
results.description: Warns against the danger of humans contracting hydatids through the careless handling of sheep and dog. Explains how, by eating offal from infected animals, the dog becomes the carrier of the disease between sheep and man. The disease my be prevented from spreading by boiling sheep offal prior to feeding to dogs, by carefully washing all vegetables to be eating raw by keeping the dog outside the home and car and by giving the dog regular medical examinations.
description_for_label: Warns against the danger of humans contracting hydatids through the careless handling of sheep and dog. Explains how, by eating offal from infected animals, the dog becomes the carrier of the disease between sheep and man. The disease my be prevented from spreading by boiling sheep offal prior to feeding to dogs, by carefully washing all vegetables to be eating raw by keeping the dog outside the home and car and by giving the dog regular medical examinations.

results.title: Hades

constellations_other.name: Iconic creative partnerships
constellations_other.description: Actor Nicholas Hoult and writer-director Tony Mcnamara worked on The Favourite together before Hoult was cast in The Great. Strong creative partnerships between particular actors and directors are the backbone of screen creativity.

results.description: A rogue-lite hack and slash dungeon crawler in which Zagreus, son of Hades the Greek god of the dead, attempts to escape his home and his oppressive father by fighting the souls of the dead through the various layers of the ever-shifting underworld, while getting to know and forging relationships with its inhabitants.
description_for_label: A rogue-lite hack and slash dungeon crawler in which Zagreus, son of Hades the Greek god of the dead, attempts to escape his home and his oppressive father by fighting the souls of the dead through the various layers of the ever-shifting underworld, while getting to know and forging relationships with its inhabitants.

results.title: Out of Sight, Out of Mind
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation and David Goldie
results.brief_description: ‘Out of Sight, Out of Mind’, in its depiction of prison conditions, helped to raise awareness about a much neglected section of our society. It provided extensive insight into the prison system, interviewing prisoners, prison officers and administrators. There are four parts titled ‘Locked Up’, ‘Surviving in the Nick’, ‘The Keepers and the Kept’, and ‘The Cycle of Crime’. This program pulls no punches, describes the conditions of various correctional institutions around Australia and also offers some suggestions for improvements.

holdings.name: MOV file H264; ACMI Digital Access Copy - presentation

results.title: Just hold still. Parts one and two
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: In his New York City Landscape, Cohen finds inspiration in disturbance. Looking to life for rhythm and to architecture for state of mind, he locates simple mysteries. `Just Hold Still’ is comprised of an interconnected series of short works and collaborations that explore the grey area between documentary, narrative and experimental genres. Part One concerns a personal, poetic approach to narrative while Part Two involves hybridized use of verite footage and the confrontation of documentary concerns with the music video format. The work can be considered as a whole or each piece in the project can be viewed (and rented) as a separate entity.
results.title_for_label: Just hold still. Parts one and two

results.title: KKND: Krush Kill 'N Destroy for DOS
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM, CD jewel case with insert and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description: In the far future of KKND: Krush Kill ‘N Destroy, a nuclear war has destroyed the Earth’s surface. The humans that were left split into two factions: The Survivors are the descendants of humans who managed to burrow under the Earth’s crust before the surface’s annihilation, taking with them what they could salvage. They survived underground for sixty years but dwindling resources has forced them to resurface. They were met by the Mutes, humans who lived through the nuclear destruction, mutated and dominated the Earth. An armed conflict between the two groups is inevitable. The game has you choosing either of these factions. As a classic real-time strategy, the focus on this game is gathering oil, building up and upgrading your base, training units and completing your objectives. Objectives can range from simply destroying an enemy presence to gathering a set amount of materials while fending off enemy attacks.

results.brief_description: In the far future of KKND: Krush Kill ‘N Destroy, a nuclear war has destroyed the Earth’s surface. The humans that were left split into two factions: The Survivors are the descendants of humans who managed to burrow under the Earth’s crust before the surface’s annihilation, taking with them what they could salvage. They survived underground for sixty years but dwindling resources has forced them to resurface. They were met by the Mutes, humans who lived through the nuclear destruction, mutated and dominated the Earth. An armed conflict between the two groups is inevitable. The game has you choosing either of these factions. As a classic real-time strategy, the focus on this game is gathering oil, building up and upgrading your base, training units and completing your objectives. Objectives can range from simply destroying an enemy presence to gathering a set amount of materials while fending off enemy attacks.
